<h2>Values</h2>
<hr>
<p>In this workshop, we'll use the term <b>value</b> to represent any datum (single unit of data). There are many different types of values in R, most commonly used are:</p>
<br>
<ul>
<li>numeric</li>
<li>integer</li>
<li>double</li>
</ul>

<h2>Types of data: Numeric values</h2>
<br>
<p>A numeric value is a number of type:</p>
<br>
<ul>
<li>integer: whole numbers</li>
<li>double: double precision floating point numbers (on the user end this can be thought of as a decimal number)</li>
</ul>
